subject: init wayland support.
commitMessage:
init wayland support.

The display server based on X or Wayland, is now a choice of different profile in Tizen 3.0.
Basically and consistently, two macros were used "with wayland" and "with x".
Below summarize the combination of the macros:

| wayland |  x  | meaning
|---------------------------
|   0     |  1  | pure X11 platform(no wayland)
|   1     |  0  | pure wayland platform (no X11)
|   1     |  1  | wayland but X compatibility
|   0     |  0  | no X and no wayland

This method unifies the meaning and usage. Deploy this method to calculator package.
Currently we need "pure wayland platform (no X11)" status,so "with wayland" and "with x" are
defined into "1" and "0" in build.conf file.If you need other status of above illustration,
please change values of "with x" and "with wayland" in your build.conf file.

Signed-off-by: wangfei <feix.w.wang@intel.com>
Change-Id: I646665c8fb8c639464c227c9ee58a404087304e7

This way to support wayland is not the way to go. Actually the usage of X in such code is not the way to go either.

I'd accept a patch that removes the X part making that platform independent as it should be, but NEVER accept such wayland code.

In other words, you should never do what the code was doing. You should rely on the window manager to set the window size for that platform (dependent on the window type).

If the window manager is not acting as expected, then it's its fault and should be fixed there, not spreading such patch in all applications.

Patch Set 3: Verified-1 Code-Review-1

(14 comments)

this entire way of doing apps is broken. it will break if you have more than 1 screen. it will break when your app is meant to use only a portion of a screen. it makes the app depdnent on lower layers it should not be dependent on.

the window manager will resize the app window accordingly WHEN the window is shown. the window will be sized based on ui policies. the app needs to do nothing at all. it will know.

if the problem is in testing and you want the window a certain size for testing - then resize it for that purpose. if the problem is that by default on a desktop style layout it comes out at 1x1 pixel - the problem is the internal layout of the window doesn't have a sensible minimum size - the content is layout out in such a way with properties that cause it to have a minimum size of 1x1. fix the layout then. don't do this.
